snippet: The heiress Rachel Mellon eventually regretted her financial donations to John Edwards, an interior decorator who acted as a go-between testified in Mr. Edwards’s trial.
abstract: Bryan Huffman, interior decorator who acted as go-between for heiress Rachel Mellon and John Edwards, testifies at Edwards's financial corruption trial that Mellon eventually regretted her donations after learning that Edwards had used some of the money to hide his pregnant mistress Rielle Hunter. Photo (M)

byline.original: By WILLIAM DUPRE AND KIM SEVERSON

lead_paragraph: GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Rachel Mellon counted Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis among her dearest friends. She amassed millions through her family's success with Listerine and her husband's banking fortune. She is an avid art collector and horticulturist, and deeply dedicated to protecting her privacy.

headline.main: Liaison Says Heiress Rued Edwards Donations
